title:CTR PvP !Backups Dupes - This is a compiled collection of god/recommended rolls from top community minds.
description:Thanks to u/Mercules904, u/pandapaxxy, @AyyItsChevy, @chrisfried, u/-seudonym-, u/zman2100, u/goddamtofu, Gleauxx, GodInGaming, Beenlab, CoolCheese, Critbuff, Apathettic, Ekuegan, Jarv, Ascendant Nomad, Shadow, Pijinnn, AbbyHour, GodinGaming, illPhysics, BRAVExHERO, Pattycakes, blueberries.gg, YeezyGT, @johnldixon, WarlockMaggie, 2bithacker, and whyayala for their contributions. Ping u/48klocs / @48klocs with any issues.

// Taraxippos
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "Taraxippos didn't make too much of a splash in PvP either, being able to use Cascade Point to blister down enemies. Now High Ground comes by and takes...well the high ground. Zen Moment will keep you on target, but I'd personally go with Kill Clip to keep things nice and easy." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:pvp,controller

// Adamantite
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "Support frame auto rifles have not been the strongest in PvP but have small niche scenarios when in a full fireteam. Demolitionist or Pugilist will depend on your build but I generally find grenades stronger than powered melees. Kill Clip is really the only option in the final column as it provides enough of a boost after a kill to offset the slight hit registration delay and get you the second+ kill." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,controller
dimwishlist:item=2987244302&perks=1015611457,3142289711,3250034553,3523296417
dimwishlist:item=2987244302&perks=1015611457,3142289711,3250034553,691659142

// Cold Denial
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "Cold Denial is a returning weapon and one of my favorites from before Origin Traits. The low zoom meant it felt more like a hand cannon, but could do more damage and two-burst if you were capable. Arrowhead Brake fixes the recoil enough to be manageable in close ranges and accurate in longer engagements. This won't top the records for range but will be sticky within its intended range. Zen Moment and Headseeker are great neutral perks that offer the best for accuracy assistance and some forgiveness in each burst." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:pvp,controller

// False Promises
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "Over in PvP False Promises has a bit more of a leg up. High damage per shot paired with a high range stat will cover most maps outside of scout rifle ranges. Cascade Point shows up here again as the firing delay is a whopping 40% dropping the time to kill from 0.83s to 0.50s. The requirements for a kill don't change at 6c but being far faster will catch people by surprise." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:pvp,controller

// Whispering Slab
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Lightweight Bows in PvP have not had a good footing starting from the health changes Bungie made. Opening Shot almost guarantees a crit and add in the bonuses from Lone Wolf and you might have a good solo weapon. It still doesn't feel incredible to miss a shot, so all these bonuses will hopefully make this bow feel adequate to use." Recommended MW: Draw Time.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=690341468&perks=201365942,2319119708,2801223209,3429800428

// Temptation's Hook
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Caster frame swords feel like they should belong in the crucible. But it always feels like it's missing something. Either the animation is too long, the tracking is too slow, maybe the damage just isn't tuned right. Valiant Charge will help closing the distance if you use this and heavy attack a second person after lunging. Tireless Blade will give you some ammo back, but there's just something off." Recommended MW: Impact.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=1587953057&perks=2590710093,269888150,3666208348,4274614370
dimwishlist:item=1587953057&perks=2590710093,269888150,4274614370,938542991

// Unsworn
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "While I normally would say something about low ammo or something. Tear fixes that. Being able to Sever nearby enemies on a precision kill is huge for following that up into a kill chain. It doesn't do anything for that first kill, but it sets up for the second and third." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=1303313141&perks=1840239774,2749775325,365154968,960997401

// Unworthy
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "Rapid Fire Frame scout rifles in PvP really need one of two perks, arguably together in order to feel phenomenal. Firmly Planted or Kill Clip. Unworthy has neither. Rapid Hit and Precision Instrument are fine but pale in comparison. Firefly will be nice for some AoE and Zen Moment is in the wrong column unless paired with Firefly." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:pvp,controller

// Vision of Confluence
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "When talking or taking Vision of Confluence into PvP you really have limited options. You have a pretty slow 1.00s TtK with 3c1b on all but T0 resilience. Zen Moment will help you keep your bullets where they need to go and Explosive Payload will make it harder for your enemies to fight back. Kill Clip allows you to drop a shot and go for 3c on all resiliences except T5 and below instead going for 2c1b. Definitely easier for kill chaining." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:pvp,controller

// Vision of Confluence (Timelost)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "When talking or taking Vision of Confluence into PvP you really have limited options. You have a pretty slow 1.00s TtK with 3c1b on all but T0 resilience. Zen Moment will help you keep your bullets where they need to go and Explosive Payload will make it harder for your enemies to fight back. Kill Clip allows you to drop a shot and go for 3c on all resiliences except T5 and below instead going for 2c1b. Definitely easier for kill chaining." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:pvp,controller

// Backfang
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Glaives are not meta in PvP. Rapid-fire glaives even less so. If you fully invest into blocking you could go for Tilting at Windmills or Replenishing Aegis. Close to Melee also works phenomenally if you can secure the kill with the glaive. // Legato-11
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Legato-11 really gets to spread its wings in the crucible. Closing Time and Lone Wolf are incredibly strong together. If you prefer Killing Wind you can pair that with Closing Time for a nice speed boost after one kill. Incandescent and Heal Clip are both solid options as slugs get one round and you can pick up another pretty quick for the reload. Offhand Strike is niche but very powerful in the right hands (or left)." Recommended MW: Range or Handling.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller

// Veleda-F
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Veleda-F is probably the only weapon I wanted to farm this season for a very easy 100 range and handling through barrels, MW and Slickdraw. Throw on Extended Mag and an Icarus grip for better AE and retire my Albruna-D. Being able to run anything in the fourth column is a nice bonus. BUT being a world drop nuked those chances. Closing Time is the nice new perk and can be paired with Lone Wolf as most people would grind for. If you're more old school you can go Snapshot and Opening Shot (as is tradition)." Recommended MW: Range or Handling.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller

// VS Pyroelectric Propellant
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "Oh boy, did I not expect to see another Adaptive Frame auto rifle. We just got Khvostov, Summoner, and Ros Arago IV. And all those weapons are strong within their own right. VS Pyroelectric Propellent has one trick up its sleeve and that's Jolting Feedback. You can pair this with Attrition Orbs for some extra orb generation, or Eddy Current for faster reload when Amplified. The other weapons fit into their specific elemental roles and that applies here too. The more you like Arc the more this weapon shines." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,controller

// Bygones
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "With the recent adjustment to High Ground (and in my humble opinion, it might get adjusted again) Bygones still two bursts with a clean 6 crit. I feel it's still a little overturned for such an easy payoff. If you're looking to get that roll you know what to look for. But outside of that roll you've got great neutral perks like Eye of the Storm, Headseeker, Zen Moment, and Keep Away. Kill Clip will always *just work* and doesn't need too much thought to keep going. Bygones still remains a top choice but it's a tad less forgiving now." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:pvp,controller

// Fair Judgment
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Fair Judgement will not shatter any expectations within the crucible. Precision frame auto rifles are just not as good as other options. Onslaught will drop the TtK with each stack and Dynamic Sway Reduction will help out in keeping the bullets going where you want them to. Outside of this it's good for ornaments and checking off another box for collections (oh and free shards)." Recommended MW: Handling.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller

// Anonymous Autumn
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "Where Anonymous Autumn and TrueVanguard both find their homes is in the crucible. Range is going to be key as sidearms get shredded in distance by autos and SMGs. Pushing out your effective range can help someone backpedaling or just when you're above them. Lone Wolf, Zen Moment, and Rangefinder all improve the feel of this weapon in different ways, coupled with Kill Clip for explosive damage in your second engagement, Precision Instrument to shave off some crits required or even drop the TtK on lower resiliences would be good if you can reliably hit crits. Harmony really shines when swapping between weapons." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,controller

//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "With the upcoming buff to Aggressive frame hand cannons, Precision Instrument isn't required but is still highly sought after for dealing with Overshields, healing rifts, restoration, cure, etc. Outside of that you've got Keep Away adding accuracy and range, and Lone Wolf buffing your stats. Depending on your environment and play style both are extremely strong. Explosive Payload still works for dealing extra flinch and Headstone is exceptional at denying revives in Trials." // Liturgy
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "Within the crucible you've got one of two options for Liturgy. The first is a primer with Chill Clip and Slideways or Surplus for extra handling to swap to your energy weapon of choice. Or as a clean up weapon with Quickdraw for lightning fast ready and Chain Reaction for big booms after you secure the kill for splash on any unsuspecting enemy teammates." Recommended MW: Blast Radius.|tags:pvp,controller

// Red Tape
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "Red Tape doesn't do anything exceptional but it does play into Stasis shenanigans if you use the crystals to gain a new sightline. You don't have to be near the Stasis crystal or enemy which means you can get Frost Armor from anywhere across the map. Keep Away and Lone Wolf also lean into this but don't give as many benefits. Explosive Payload would be great for fighting duals as the extra flinch is incredibly frustrating to fight against." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:pvp,controller

//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "Adaptive frame pulse rifles have fallen off a bit with the exception of Bygones which will be toned down by the time this releases. Keep Away and Headseeker are great neutral perks but Vantage Point really exists as a neutral weapon. // Rake Angle
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "While I wouldn't recommend glaives for most players it is a niche play style with high risk, high reward. The handful of players with thousands of glaive kills really pad those numbers up for the community. You know what to expect and grind for if PvP is where you're taking Rake Angle. For those outside the know, Replenishing Aegis and Unstoppable Force are great to start with and move on to Close to Melee or Chill Clip depending on your newfound build." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller

// Chroma Rush
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "Rapid-Fire Autos frequently manage to be a sleeper pick in PvP due to their Optimal TTK being 0.75s (exception being T10 Resilience at 0.83s) and this one is no different. Chroma Rush brings a respectable selection of perks, with many options to boost lower stats and/or increase damage. Target Lock can smooth out the TTK to 0.75s or Kill Clip with its blistering 0.58s for T9 and below! Combined with the origin trait, Chroma Rush will feel quite lethal and snappy!" Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,controller

// Sacred Provenance
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "Aggressive frame pulse rifles fall short of their High-Impact frame brethren. They still two burst but ever so slightly slower and the longer bursts can make tracking difficult. Rapid Hit can make landing those two taps easier and Headseeker can bake in some forgiveness if you hit a body shot first. Kill Clip bakes in even more forgiveness if you secure a kill first and Desperado can make your two burst even faster than the High-Impact Frame pulses which is neat. Unfortunately it takes activating a perk to achieve the same success they have natively but it will catch people by surprise." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:pvp,controller

// Reckless Oracle
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "Reckless Oracle did not need a lot to feel good in PvP and Kill Clip gave you a blistering fast time to kill. Keep Away will give you a good bit of bonus accuracy, but your range goes from 22m at base to just above 31m at max range and a ballistic mod. So you're mostly fighting against juiced SMGs instead of your standard auto rifle. Keeping range in mind this will shred within that defined range." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:pvp,controller

// BrayTech Werewolf
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Precision Frame auto rifles got a recent buff but still don't feel as dominant as they did in year 1 of Destiny 2. Wild that we've come this far. Lone Wolf will give you the best feel for being solo but if you prefer to team-shoot or just live in 6s your better perks are Dynamic Sway Reduction or Zen Moment. Kill Clip is tried and true for the fourth column. Tap the Trigger does stack with our accuracy boosts in the third column for an extremely sticky auto rifle. Desperate Measures is my favorite neutral damage perk that can work with any ability build." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller

// Arcane Embrace
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Arcane Embrace is not good in PvP. You need to land both shots to kill and one *has* to be a crit in order for you to secure the kill. Tap the Trigger and Closing Time both help your accuracy and Lone Wolf will boost your mid tier aim assist. If you treat this like a normal shotgun or slug you're going to have a bad time." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller

// Jurassic Green
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "Over in the crucible you've got a few things to keep in mind. AST base Jurassic Green hits out to 30.64m. at max you're only gaining ~5m. The better play is to invest your stats into consistency perks. Closing Time and Lone Wolf are both new and exciting perks but Keep Away is tried and true. Kill Clip will make follow up kills easier and depending on your build you could go for Adrenaline Junkie or even Desperate Measures. Headseeker is the best neutral option in the fourth column." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:pvp,controller

// Mechabre
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Over in PvP you've got two different Ros to go for with combinations between them. The tried and true Snapshot Sights / Opening Shot will always work, especially good if you didn't get the free roll from Festival of the Lost past. Lone Wolf and Closing Time is the new hotness and works best with a mag boosting perk or backup mag to get 2 attempts with Closing Time (versus one shot with the base magazine of 3)." Recommended MW: Handling.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller

// Acosmic
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Over in PvP grenade launchers lost a lot of their shine with the health changes. 70 Blast Radius is the target to hit. Impulse Amplifier to boost up grenade Velocity. Withering Gaze with Proximity Grenades or High-Explosive Ordinance wouldn't be the worst combo as you won't be able to OHK and be able to swap to your primary or special for easy clean ups. Explosive Light is easy to get with orb generation through Reaper or Siphon mods. If you opt for general use you can go with Chain Reaction." Recommended MW: Blast Radius.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller

// Arcane Embrace
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Arcane Embrace is not good in PvP. You need to land both shots to kill and one *has* to be a crit in order for you to secure the kill. Tap the Trigger and Closing Time both help your accuracy and Lone Wolf will boost your mid tier aim assist. If you treat this like a normal shotgun or slug you're going to have a bad time." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller

// Jurassic Green
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "Over in the crucible you've got a few things to keep in mind. AST base Jurassic Green hits out to 30.64m. at max you're only gaining ~5m. The better play is to invest your stats into consistency perks. Closing Time and Lone Wolf are both new and exciting perks but Keep Away is tried and true. Kill Clip will make follow up kills easier and depending on your build you could go for Adrenaline Junkie or even Desperate Measures. Headseeker is the best neutral option in the fourth column." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:pvp,controller

// Mechabre
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Over in PvP you've got two different Ros to go for with combinations between them. The tried and true Snapshot Sights / Opening Shot will always work, especially good if you didn't get the free roll from Festival of the Lost past. Lone Wolf and Closing Time is the new hotness and works best with a mag boosting perk or backup mag to get 2 attempts with Closing Time (versus one shot with the base magazine of 3)." // Acosmic
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Over in PvP grenade launchers lost a lot of their shine with the health changes. 70 Blast Radius is the target to hit. Impulse Amplifier to boost up grenade Velocity. Withering Gaze with Proximity Grenades or High-Explosive Ordinance wouldn't be the worst combo as you won't be able to OHK and be able to swap to your primary or special for easy clean ups. Explosive Light is easy to get with orb generation through Reaper or Siphon mods. If you opt for general use you can go with Chain Reaction." Recommended MW: Blast Radius.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller

// Bold Endings
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "Bold Endings and by extension Warden's Law don't really fit in any particular play style. They have good range, good chunk damage, but behave more like a pulse rifle / Crimson. They're not bad but take away one of hand cannon’s strongest benefits, peek shooting. If you want to use this competitively, you'll want as consistent of a hand cannon as.possible. Rapid Hit and Eye of the Storm add much needed consistency, while To the Pain can pair well with Eye of the Storm for maximum AA / accuracy bonuses." Recommended MW: Stability ornHandling.|tags:pvp,controller

// The Call
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Rocket-Assisted Frames are not super strong in PvP. Slice allows you to sever your opponents and get a bit of a damage advantage. Beacon Rounds adds some flexibility in your shots as it adds in tracking. Strategist is gonna be best if you're using a high class ability build. In terms.of the fourth column, Adrenaline Junkie or Desperate Measures are both easy to get 20% damage or more with ability usage. While it's more of an on / off weapon where without a damage perk it does pretty whelming damage, once you get an ability kill it can allow you to roll over teams easier." // Speleologist
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "Over in PvP you can take advantage of the blistering TtK at 0.40s with 7 crits on all resilience levels. One stack of Killing Tally adds forgiveness but if you manage to get 2 kills you’ll drop T4 resilience guardians in a blistering 0.33s (3 stacks of Killing Tally bring the resilience gate to T9). Incandescent would probably be my pick as you’re not trying to guess what resilience level your enemies are at and allows for some splash damage also making the second kill easier. You can also swap off this weapon allowing for a more fluid game experience." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:pvp,controller

// Maahes HC4
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "Maahes HC4 in the crucible isn’t as strong as a dedicated 120 or 140 hand cannon. These weapons lack the peek shooting capabilities and don’t out range the other archetypes falling somewhere between the two. You’ll want to boost the weapons stats via Rapid Hit, Perpetual Motion or even Enlightened Action. Unrelenting stays up for a longer time than most players expect and can act as a pseudo Heal Clip when you chain kills. The easiest way to do that is with Golden Tricorn or Swashbuckler depending on the build you’re going for. Void builds should use Golden Tricorn to get to 2x allowing for a blistering 3c1b TtK at 0.57s. If you’re not going void but invest in strength or a melee build, Swashbuckler 5x allows for the same TtK but at 4c at all resilience levels. Golden Tricorn adds forgiveness but has the tradeoff of being slightly harder to pull off" Recommended MW: Range or Stability.|tags:pvp,controller

//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "The Riposte has better utility in PvP where Killing Wind, Tap the Trigger, or Zen Moment each bring more to the table than in the PvE arena. // Crimil's Dagger
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "Does Crimil’s Dagger have a foot to stand on in PvP? Yes it does. It doesn’t have the best third column being Slideways instead of Slideshot or even Rapid Hit. Enlightened Action feels strong on Malediction and can be enhanced on both Malediction and Crimil’s Dagger allowing for higher stacks of handling and reload speed, both of which are desperately needed. Precision Instrument is the perk that allows Crimil’s Dagger to compete with Igneous Hammer for best 120 in the game but the real competition for Crimi’s Dagger is Something New which will make its re-entrance later this season." Recommended MW: Range or Stability.|tags:pvp,controller

// Claws of the Wolf (PvE)
// Arrowhead Brake, (Flared Magwell, Tactical Mag, High-Caliber Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Ricochet Rounds), Repulsor Brace, Destabilizing Rounds
//notes:Adamsdown_Boy - information as at v8.0.0.6 (PvE / PvE-MinorSpec / PvE-God / M+KB / Controller): PvE pick for add-clearing Minor enemies in general content, particularly with void fragments. Claws of the Wolf returns in season 24 with a largely new (largely PvP-focussed) perk pool, but with stats the look a bit anaemic by comparison with its peers. The Recoil Direction needs a bit of attention, so Arrowhead Brake is the obvious barrel perk to sort that out. In the magazine perk slot, you could either look to fill out the stats a little more, or get a combat effect mag perk. If you don't already have an Elsie's Rifle with the void combination of Repulsor Brace and Destabilizing Rounds in the two trait perk columns, then this roll can synergise with void fragments to boost the subclass verbs and provide a void overshield while clearing groups of adds. Unfortunately, the Skulking Wolf origin trait has no effect outside of Iron Banner. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a Backup Mag mod.
dimwishlist:item=1505862304&perks=2048641572,3230963543,776531651,839105230
dimwishlist:item=1505862304&perks=1968497646,2048641572,776531651,839105230

// Forbearance
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Hitting 3 targets in PvE is certainly easier than hitting multiple targets in PvP. If you can make Stats for All work in PvP I will be impressed. A better perk would be Demolitionist for a total of 15% ability energy back on kills (10% paired with 5% from the origin trait), or Disruption Break to give your kinetic weapons a nice 50% damage boost. There isn't a lot to be said in column 4 for PvP as most Disruption Break grenade launchers are paired with Auto-Loading Holster in the third column. Wellspring could pair well with Demolitionist for even more ability energy, or Desperate Measures for a damage bonus without needing a weapon kill to start." Recommended MW: Velocity.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller

// The Mountaintop
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Mountaintop originally didn't have much of a footing in PvP but quickly dove right into our nightmares. If you want a quick-swap roll go for Slickdraw. If you want more of a long ranged tube shotgun roll, Impulse Amplifier will make the grenade shot near instant. With the way special ammo is shaking up in the crucible through the meter or boxes, I think some of the best perks for Mountaintop are the swap perks, Harmony and Recombination. Both allow you to build up a higher damage shot to make Mountaintop one shot again, bringing it back to Recluse or another Harmony weapon to flex on all the hunters out there." Recommended MW: Velocity.|tags:pvp,controller,mkb

// The Recluse
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Recluse’s defining trait, Master of Arms, being brought down to a 15% damage buff makes it more manageable as a weapon and less dominant in PvE and PvP. Instead you could opt for consistency perks like Dynamic Sway Reduction, or Tap the Trigger. Threat Detector and Hip-Fire Grip are both excellent but have more limiting use cases; distance and non-ADS respectively. Desperate Measures is a better lethality perk as it can activate while stowed, so once you get a grenade or melee kill it lets you relive the 20% damage bonus of pre-nerf Master of Arms." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,controller,mkb

// Hung Jury SR4
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Speaking of the crucible the curated roll is almost perfect, if you don't like Enlightened Action you could instead opt for No Distractions or Rapid Hit. Both make subsequent shots easier to hit so you can achieve that blistering fast TtK. If you don't like the “gimmick” of Box Breathing you could try and farm our rolls with Explosive Payload or Cascade Point. The former adding extra flinch, the latter dropping the TtK to 0.60s but still requiring 3 crits and 1 body shot." Recommended MW: Stability or Handling.|tags:pvp,controller,mkb

If you wanted to really show some players their own ghosts you could instead opt for Onslaught to delete them at a blistering pace. Over-Under is another good shout here to get rid of most players in rifts. I wouldn't mind hearing more Hammerheads in the crucible. At least I'd know where they are." // Blast Furnace
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "Over in the Crucible Blast Furnace has yet to make its mark. It has some stiff competition in the form of both Belisarius-D and Disparity. Both of which come with some incredible rolls. Outside of its frame you have some other strong pulses like the new Relentless or Messenger (Adept). Blast Furnace does have a leg up over recent additions with the combination of Zen Moment and Kill Clip for easy follow-up two burst kills. Outside of S16 Messenger (which might not be possible due to the perk updates) no other aggressive frame pulse has that combination. (Elsie's Rifle also gets this combo but we will talk about that later). Another lethal combo is Headseeker and Kill Clip which allows for double damage, the only other pulse to get this combination is Chattering Bone." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:controller,pvp

// Midnight Coup
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "If you were to take a roll into the Crucible, I would recommend Moving Target or Explosive Payload in the third column. Especially now that Explosive Payload has been brought back up to not have a resilience check. Moving Target will bring Midnight Coup to a nice even 100 aim assist, the only other gun to achieve this is Eyasluna with Moving Target, any sight, and a targeting adjustor. Pair this with Zen Moment or Opening Shot and you'll have an incredibly strong dueling weapon. Zen Moment makes subsequent shots easier by increasing your flinch resistance, and Opening Shot starting the duel out on the best possible foot. Midnight Coup suffers from below average range, so I would recommend Hammer-Forged Rifling to bring that up, with Zen Moment you won't need to worry about stability as much, but I would stay away from dropping any stats with Full Bore." Recommended MW: Range or Stability.|tags:pvp,controller

// Outbreak Perfected
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "If you would like to bring the nanites into PvP I would opt for one of two ways. Arrowhead Brake at the front end for added recoil direction, Accurized Rounds for the extra range. Headseeker or Rapid Hit depending on what you value, and your choice of Short-Action Stock for more handling or Hand-Laid Stock for the most stability. The alternative way is with Fitted Stock to bring you right up to 100 recoil direction meaning you can slot in Smallbore or even Hammer-Forged Rifling for more range. You drop some handling unless you make that up in your barrel."|tags:pvp,controller

// Forbearance (Holofoil)
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Hitting 3 targets in PvE is certainly easier than hitting multiple targets in PvP. If you can make Stats for All work in PvP I will be impressed. A better perk would be Demolitionist for a total of 15% ability energy back on kills (10% paired with 5% from the origin trait), or Disruption Break to give your kinetic weapons a nice 50% damage boost. There isn't a lot to be said in column 4 for PvP as most Disruption Break grenade launchers are paired with Auto-Loading Holster in the third column. // The Mountaintop (Holofoil)
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Mountaintop originally didn't have much of a footing in PvP but quickly dove right into our nightmares. If you want a quick-swap roll go for Slickdraw. If you want more of a long ranged tube shotgun roll, Impulse Amplifier will make the grenade shot near instant. With the way special ammo is shaking up in the crucible through the meter or boxes, I think some of the best perks for Mountaintop are the swap perks, Harmony and Recombination. Both allow you to build up a higher damage shot to make Mountaintop one shot again, bringing it back to Recluse or another Harmony weapon to flex on all the hunters out there." Recommended MW: Velocity.|tags:pvp,controller,mkb

// The Recluse (Holofoil)
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Recluse’s defining trait, Master of Arms, being brought down to a 15% damage buff makes it more manageable as a weapon and less dominant in PvE and PvP. Instead you could opt for consistency perks like Dynamic Sway Reduction, or Tap the Trigger. Threat Detector and Hip-Fire Grip are both excellent but have more limiting use cases; distance and non-ADS respectively. Desperate Measures is a better lethality perk as it can activate while stowed, so once you get a grenade or melee kill it lets you relive the 20% damage bonus of pre-nerf Master of Arms." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,controller,mkb

// Hung Jury SR4 (Holofoil)
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Speaking of the crucible the curated roll is almost perfect, if you don't like Enlightened Action you could instead opt for No Distractions or Rapid Hit. Both make subsequent shots easier to hit so you can achieve that blistering fast TtK. If you don't like the “gimmick” of Box Breathing you could try and farm our rolls with Explosive Payload or Cascade Point. The former adding extra flinch, the latter dropping the TtK to 0.60s but still requiring 3 crits and 1 body shot." Recommended MW: Stability or Handling.|tags:pvp,controller,mkb

// Hammerhead (Holofoil)
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "Over on the PvP side, machine guns haven't been high meta but they have always felt good. If you wanted to really show some players their own ghosts you could instead opt for Onslaught to delete them at a blistering pace. Over-Under is another good shout here to get rid of most players in rifts. I wouldn't mind hearing more Hammerheads in the crucible. At least I'd know where they are." // Blast Furnace (Holofoil)
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "Over in the Crucible Blast Furnace has yet to make its mark. It has some stiff competition in the form of both Belisarius-D and Disparity. Both of which come with some incredible rolls. Outside of its frame you have some other strong pulses like the new Relentless or Messenger (Adept). Blast Furnace does have a leg up over recent additions with the combination of Zen Moment and Kill Clip for easy follow-up two burst kills. Outside of S16 Messenger (which might not be possible due to the perk updates) no other aggressive frame pulse has that combination. (Elsie's Rifle also gets this combo but we will talk about that later). Another lethal combo is Headseeker and Kill Clip which allows for double damage, the only other pulse to get this combination is Chattering Bone." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:controller,pvp

// Midnight Coup (Holofoil)
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "If you were to take a roll into the Crucible, I would recommend Moving Target or Explosive Payload in the third column. Especially now that Explosive Payload has been brought back up to not have a resilience check. Moving Target will bring Midnight Coup to a nice even 100 aim assist, the only other gun to achieve this is Eyasluna with Moving Target, any sight, and a targeting adjustor. Pair this with Zen Moment or Opening Shot and you'll have an incredibly strong dueling weapon. Zen Moment makes subsequent shots easier by increasing your flinch resistance, and Opening Shot starting the duel out on the best possible foot. Midnight Coup suffers from below average range, so I would recommend Hammer-Forged Rifling to bring that up, with Zen Moment you won't need to worry about stability as much, but I would stay away from dropping any stats with Full Bore." Recommended MW: Range or Stability.|tags:pvp,controller

// Adjudicator
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "Adjudicator is back and I was really hoping for a replacement for my Antiope-D, while this isn’t it I can confidently use this for a similar feel. Dynamic Sway Reduction will keep those bullets tight and on target while Target Lock will adjust your optimal TtK. Onslaught is probably going to be on my personal roll, but I’ll have to actually get it to drop first." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,controller

// The Summoner
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "PvP has far less options but still some solid options. Instead of different niches within the grand scheme of PvE content, we really have consistency or lethality 2x. Within both you’ll find a healthy scoop of stability perks, either Zen Moment, Dynamic Sway Reduction, or Perpetual Motion. Pick your poison there. If you want more consistency on top of your consistency sundae, go for Tap the Trigger. For lethality you can opt for Target Lock, Onslaught, or the tried and true Kill Clip. All options are great but work in different ways, your best option might not be the same as others so give them a try." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,controller

// Judgment
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "Judgment lost a little bit of its edge in the crucible. You can still get Slideshot and Opening Shot. It’s not that Judgment is bad, just that other weapons edged it out and 140’s aren’t exactly strong in this meta (for the first time in a while). Hitmark HCS, SteadyHand HCS, or FastDraw HCS are all great options and allow you to add some much needed stats and aim assist. I am surprised Bungie didn’t swap Judgment over to barrels. I guess hand cannon sights are easier than “sights” if that makes sense." Recommended MW: Range or Stability.|tags:pvp,controller

// Multimach CCX
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "Multimach is back and boy do I have conflicting views on this. Should we invest in lethality or consistency? Iron Reach will be incredible in 3v3 game modes, as well as Trials and potentially in Rumble, but Kill Clip will be even better for 6v6 game modes or slayers. Ideally you’ll find a healthy mix of range and stability, but Dynamic Sway Reduction will cover most of your stability if you opt for Iron Reach. If you prefer Kill Clip, then I would recommend Moving Target for better movement speed and being that quick slayer we all know you are." Recommended MW: Range or Stability.|tags:pvp,controller

// Taraxippos
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "With the update to scout rifle damage, I think there’s a good case for this scout being a low-key meta choice. It won’t have as good of a feeling as the rapid-fire frames, nor the oomph of the high-impacts. But the extra movement speed and the extra flexibility could aid certain builds and loadouts. I love kill clip for really deleting guardians in 6s, but it falls off hard in 3s." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:pvp,controller

// The Title
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Swashbuckler is really the only standout perk in the fourth column. Some more niche options exist but there’s also not really a big pull to use this year's version of the Title for PvP. Rangefinder does help push out your zoom but with the recent changes to rangefinder it’s less than stellar." Recommended MW: Range (M+KB) / Stability (Controller).|tags:pvp,mkb,controller

// Hullabaloo
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "While I don’t think anyone will be vying for this roll in PvP I think the best use case is a swap build. Not ideal for “wasting” heavy to not get the kill with it. But being a wave frame you won’t get a ton of direct hits to kill. If a guardian jumps it’s all over. Ideal for pubs, not ideal for most PvP situations." Recommended MW: Velocity.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=657927352&perks=1683379515,2822142346,3525010810,951095735

// Hullabaloo
//notes:SirStallion (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "This weapon for PvP is tricky.. Wave frames are fun, but a heavy wave frame? Who knows, it might be a blast. And I intend to find out, by creating additional blasts and trying to utilise Chain Reaction to net some fun triple kills.. Or more. Imagine more.. It seems that Blast Radius really doesn't bring much to the table for wave frames, and I would assume that the heavy variant is much the same, so Im focusing on velocity to get my nades where they need to be ASAP." Recommended MW: Velocity.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller

// Vouchsafe
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "Lightweight frames in PvP are in an interesting spot. They don’t kill fast enough to be competitive, and any boosts don’t really elevate the weapon further. Golden Tricorn 2x does allow you to 3 shot any guardian at any resilience at a 0.60 TtK, but it requires two whole kills to get rolling and without additional ability kills you’ll be back at square one before you know it. Taraxippos and Eternal Blazon with Kill Clip or even Tarnished Mettle with Swashbuckler allow you to 3 crit after just one kill." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:pvp,controller

// Appentence
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Taking Appetence into the crucible might be a big test of your patience. Already having low ammo, and the current economy of ammo bricks will severely limit your overall usage. If you can horde ammo bricks like Scrooge you can certainly make this weapon work better. Enlightened Action will make the weapon feel better, and Headstone can deny revives or build into the Stasis subclass like in PvE. Killing Tally can work if you use nothing but this trace rifle but I wouldn’t advise it." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller

// Imperative
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "Most of us already have. Workhorse PvE scout. If this is your first season playing destiny either as a new light or a returning player, Imperative has one great redeeming factor; damage. Imperative belongs to the high-impact archetype of scouts giving it the slowest firing rate but the highest damage. Pairing that with more damage through Adrenaline Junkie, some AoE damage through Kinetic Tremors or Explosive Payload. All of these will be happily paired with Rapid Hit for the bonuses to the low stability and reload speed. Subsistence and Keep Away both mitigate the low reload speed by bypassing reload entirely or speeding it up, respectively. I’d still recommend Rapid Hit over both as missing a shot is extremely unforgiving with the slower rate of fire. Precision hits are going to be the goal, why not make follow up shot easier while we’re at it." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:pvp,controller

// Adhortative
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "With such a similar pulse existing in PvP it comes down to perks. Forge’s Pledge gets access to Accurized and Steady Rounds, while Adhortative comes with High-Caliber and Ricochet Rounds. Forge’s Pledge comes with Zen Moment and Elemental Capacitor for big bonuses in stats, while Adhortative has Headseeker or Incandescent for better neutrality or some AoE. Depending on your preferred play style you might prefer one over the other, but I cannot emphasize this enough: both can work wonders." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:pvp,controller

// Optative
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "Keep Away is stronger in the crucible where range matters far more. Kill Clip gives you nostalgia for the Not Forgotten or Luna’s Howl days of yore with a 0.67 time to kill. You are put in a time constraint which some players might not like, but in 6v6 game modes it’s not too hard to find another unwilling participant. Fully invested into range your Optative can reach out to 34.66 meters, for the record that is further by over 1 meter than catalyzed Thorn. The drawback is the lower 1.0 s TtK but once you get going with the 0.67 TtK you can destroy any Thorn user. (Food for thought)." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,controller

// Scalar Potential
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "Scalar Potential doesn’t reinvent the wheel. The perks unique to it aren’t useful in the crucible spare Enlightened Action which will make this pulse feel better but not help its lethality. Neutrally with Headseeker you could have a pulse that feels fantastic, but Keep Away will probably be better for the range and accuracy bonuses. If you like the model and sights I’d suggest grinding out the patterns, if you already have another rapid-fire frame pulse I wouldn’t worry too much about this one." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:pvp,controller

// Breakneck
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "Breakneck is one of those weapons where if you like it, you’ll use it everywhere no matter what. It isn’t incredible in the crucible, but it can hold its own as a precision frame auto rifle. Breakneck gets a touch of SUROS Regime by either speeding up the RPM post kill with Onslaught or slowing it down with Adagio. Depending on how you play, one might feel better than the other. If you’re not looking for a legendary SUROS I’d recommend consistency perks to have a reliable precision frame from gunfight to gunfight." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,controller

// Parabellum
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "Adaptive frame submachine guns are my favorite in PvP. They combine a good weapon feel with good damage too. The Hero’s Burden is amazing with Kill Clip. Parabellum gets two damage perks both with different feels. Adagio will give you forgiveness and keep your time to kill relatively the same. If you can activate Frenzy you’ll drop your time to kill down to a blistering 0.67s but you’ll have to keep Frenzy up in order to maintain that momentum. I have a difficult time playing the mini game of “Frenzy.”" Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,controller

// Ros Arago IV
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "Over in the crucible it is slightly better and slightly worse than Gnawing Hunger. Instead of getting bonus damage through Kill Clip you can decrease your time to kill via Onslaught. With arguably a better accuracy perk in Dynamic Sway Reduction over Zen Moment. It ultimately will depend on which model you prefer as well as which version you’d like. Both technically have time to kill reducing post-kill perks as well as accuracy boosting perks." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,controller
dimwishlist:item=3583275737&perks=1359896290,3142289711,839105230,95528736

// Belisarius-D
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "Belisarius-D comes from the crucible, and it belongs in the crucible. Rapid Hit and Headseeker are fantastic neutral perks that no one would argue belong together. Keep Away and Moving Target can substitute as well for a very strong neutral weapon. Eye of the Storm is conditional in that you will have to take damage, but the benefits far outweigh the drawbacks. In the crucible you will be taking damage, so getting some extra benefits alongside that is all upsides. Kill Clip doesn’t change the time to kill enough to be noticeable unless you hit nothing but headshots. In which case you’ll drop down to a 0.60 TtK with 6 crits on Tier 8 Resilience or below. Without Kill Clip on those higher tiered resilience levels you’ll need 1 extra bullet, either way it still remains a two-burst as you won’t stop the burst mid-burst." Recommended MW - Range.|tags:pvp,controller

// Indebted Kindness
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Indebted Kindness is extremely interesting in the crucible. Impulse Amplifier can turn this into a near instant pseudo-grenade launcher shot, but I think most players are going to opt for Beacon Rounds for better tracking and hip-fire usage. The tracking isn’t incredible side to side, for when a Dawnblade flies across your screen, but for general strafing the tracking at low levels is great. At higher buffs you can start to get into a groove and be a bit more loose with your aim, but I wouldn’t rely heavily on the tracking. Adagio makes Indebted Kindness a reliable two shot, which I think feeds well into Beacon Rounds." Recommended MW: Velocity.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=3381450498&perks=2822142346,2859149211,3525010810,3673922083

// Warden's Law (Adept) - Controller PvP (controller,pvp)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "I would like to get my hands on a Warden's Law with Zen Moment to see if I can completely ignore stability as one trigger pull will grant my 4 stacks (2 per hit). It would feel incredible with that and Moving Target for more aim assist. Rampage and Kill Clip can both make the two burst easier and require less crits, but it won't be enough to one burst on its own. Kill Clip with a Ward of Dawn will be able to one burst dealing 124 to the head and 78 to the body. Really easy to down an enemy in record time." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:controller,pvp

// Igneous Hammer (Adept) - Controller PvP (controller,pvp)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "Igneous Hammer is a real do-it-all but the crucible is where the Hammer can flex its wings. // Qua Xaphan V - Controller PvP (controller,pvp)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "There are not many uses for a high-impact machine gun in PvP. They require all crits but just feel extremely unforgiving. Anything to bump up the consistency will be greatly appreciated. Dynamic Sway Reduction or Under Pressure, and Ricochet Rounds will feel great. Rampage might not be the best but it does allow you to 3 crit 1 body any resilience and 2 crit 2 body all the way up to 7 resilience. Adrenaline Junkie isn't quite as strong on the low end. But if you can get a grenade kill you can 3 crit any resilience for a 0.33s TtK. Incredibly fast." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:controller,pvp

// Unending Tempest - Controller PvP (controller,pvp)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "Unending Tempest will be the next best submachine gun. Rivaling but not as strong as release The Immortal. The only issue is the large perk pool, but you can always work around that by playing crucible for more resets. The best perks depend on how you play. Killing Wind will help you get to and beat out your next engagement, Multikill Clip works here, but Kill Clip would have been better. Dynamic Sway Reduction will help keep your bullets on target paired with Target Lock for that quick TtK. Finally you could also try to hit max range with Fragile Focus and boost up your other stats with Perpetual Motion. It's definitely going to be a dominant SMG this season, and if you prefer precision SMGs like myself it will be worth the grind." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:controller,pvp

// Deadpan Delivery - Controller PvP (controller,pvp)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "I'm not going to lie. I got excited by this shotgun for one mere fact. Slickdraw. I know it's not everyone's cup of tea, but it has been mine for the past season. I have been slowly collecting Slickdraw weapons and changing crafted weapons to utilize Slickdraw. Now I know Slickdraw reduces your auto-aim cone size; it just means you have to be a bit more accurate when aiming. You can achieve a similar effect of Slickdraw by going with Arc Elemental Capacitor, Barrel Shroud, a Handling MW, and Quick Access Sling for 96 handling. This gives you a ready speed of 0.20s and an aim down sights speed of 0.23s. However just having Slickdraw drops you to the same ready speed and drops a hundredth of a second off of aim down sights. This means you can invest every other stat point into range. Bungie knew what they were doing when bringing in this weapon as Deadpan Delivery has the second lowest range stat of all Aggressive Frame shotguns even losing to the Uncommon Ded Nemoris II." Recommended MW: Handling.|tags:controller,pvp

// Kept Confidence - Controller PvP (pvp,controller)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "PvP is another story. There's really only one or two ways this hand cannon can work. You can either opt for a "win more" perk like Killing Wind or a more neutral perk like Quickdraw depending on how you play. Neither are exceptionally better than the other, but the main pairing for both is Eye of the Storm. Kept Confidence could have been released as a static weapon like Epochal Integration and people would still use the same perks. Your barrel and masterwork choice is really up to preference if you want more stability, handling, or range." Recommended MW: Range or Stability.|tags:pvp,controller

// Nightshade - Controller PvP (controller,pvp)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "Nightshade in PvP has had an interesting run. From being a viable option in Vanilla, to being passed over with random rolls, to being an off meta choice in its revival, to being outclassed, and finally returning again. What a ride. Arrowhead Brake is again my choice in barrels, but if you can control the recoil direction you can certainly opt for other options. Ricochet Rounds is the best in slot whenever it is available so please choose that. High-Caliber Rounds can work but I find neutrally the bump in stability outweighs possibly flinching off my opponent. In the third column it is all about Keep Away. Being able to get a range bump for free is incredible. I prefer Kill Clip for an easier time 1v2'ing as I am usually in a bad situation, but Headseeker is better neutrally for any 1vX situation as it's always on. With my roll choices you can have 100 recoil direction with a counterbalance mod and 32m of in game range. Plenty to take advantage of the bonuses of Keep Away." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:controller,pvp

// The Showrunner - Controller PvP (controller,pvp)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "In PvP The Showrunner is going to be the least used SMG this season right behind Unending Tempest. Go see why I think that SMG is better in the Vendor breakdown. The Showrunner has some great perks in Target Lock and Dynamic Sway Reduction, Rangefinder if you're really looking for consistency at range, or more neutral perks like Well Rounded or Heating Up. However, the issue is really the frame we were given. Lightweight SMGs are not "in the spotlight." While I think this SMG can serve you well as a kinetic Funnelweb the perks to note aren't as strong. You can almost hit 100 range with Full Bore, Ricochet, Well Rounded 2x, and Fragile Focus, but that sacrifices Target Lock and Dynamic Sway Reduction for only 23m of range." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:controller,pvp

// The Eremite - Controller PvP (controller,pvp)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "I'm sure most people have seen u/Legoleflash's new video on the Eremite (if you haven't, go watch it https://youtu.be/csuxec3lFcs). Essentially the main point is enhanced Slickdraw doesn't feel terrible and allows you to full send into range. With Slickdraw maxing out your handling you can even opt for handling reducing perks like Full Bore, or, better yet, Extended Barrel for a bump in recoil direction. If you don't like Slickdraw there you could opt for Offhand Strike and find a good balance of range and stability." Recommended MW: Range or Charge Time.|tags:controller,pvp

// Locus Locutus - Controller PvP (controller,pvp)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "In PvP Thoughtless is hands down better. Thoughtless can roll Snapshot or Headstone. Perpetual Motion for a better handling bonus. The only reason you want to use Locus Locutus over Thoughtless is due to Opening Shot being stacked on Keep Away. This way you can stack fully into handling as enhanced Opening Shot and Keep Away with Accurized Rounds puts you at a flat 100 range. While not the most optimal in most Guardian's eyes, it will still be a solid weapon to use." Recommended MW: Handling.|tags:controller,pvp

// Abyss Defiant - Controller PvP (controller,pvp)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "High-impact autos in PvP are not strong. Can you slay out with them? For sure. Are they meta? Definitely not. Kill Clip is the strongest perk you can use on Abyss Defiant, and your choice of accuracy booster will keep your bullets true. Reconstruction is here for anyone who dislikes reloading. Eye of the Storm will help in pure 1v1 fights but will fall off in any 1v2+ fights. Swashbuckler could be fun with any of the melee heavy builds to get an incredibly fast 0.67s TtK with 4 crits and 1 body. (psst, with Radiant it becomes a 4 crit kill at 0.50s TtK, just FYI)." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:controller,pvp

// Fang of Ir Yût - Controller PvP (controller,pvp)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "Fang isn’t as strong over in the crucible where map design doesn’t always lead to good scout rifle engagements. Being a rapid-fire frame does give this weapon an edge in closer gunfights but I would use another weapon for CQC. The best perks here are definitely Keep Away or Rapid Hit and Kill Clip. // Song of Ir Yût - Controller PvP (controller,pvp)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "Machine guns have not had a dominant presence in PvP since Hammerhead was sunset (RIP). You can make Song of Ir Yut feel great by bumping up all its stats. I would argue it’s better than Target Lock because you’ll only be getting half a magazine in PvP but if the damage scales like I think it does, it could be incredible (I’ll edit this if I am wrong.)" // Swordbreaker - Controller PvP (controller,pvp)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "Swordbreaker is interesting. It might take the place of the best lightweight frame shotgun. Being craftable, tying with the highest handling within its archetype, and being able to hit 100 range are just a few things that makes Swordbreaker interesting. You can choose a variety of different perks, you only need one handling perk and Threat Detector to hit 100 handling with an animation scalar, meaning you can invest the rest of your perks into range. Going with Smallbore, Accurized Rounds, and Opening Shot puts you at 91 range and 100 handling. Or you can opt for 100 range and 91 handling by swapping a few things around. The best part of this shotgun is its versatility." Recommended MW: Handling or Range.|tags:controller,pvp

// Word of Crota - Controller PvP (controller,pvp)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "Precision frame hand cannons are not meta in PvP. Killing Wind and a damage perk can make you competitive after a kill, but that’s just it. It has to be after an initial kill. For most players a 120 or a 140 will do better, just keep in mind a grenade kill with Adrenaline Junkie puts you a 0.67s TtK only requiring 2 crits and 1 body shot. Similar to Kill Clip or old Not Forgotten / Luna’s Howl era. You do need to get a grenade kill first, but it can wipe teams." Recommended MW: Handling.|tags:controller,pvp

// The Eremite - The Eremite PvP God Roll (god-pvp,pvp,controller)
//notes: Range Masterwork. Taken from https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=csuxec3lFcs "Slickdraw gives you 100 handling no matter what else you run on your weapon, plus a .95x animation  duration multiplier, which is a scalar that takes you past what 100 handling can even do. The automatic 100 handling allows me to do WHATEVER I want to the detriment of handling, because it will ALWAYS be 100. So I can run Extended Barrel to bump my Recoil Direction to 85 and my range up 10, without any drawbacks of handling like I normally would... I suggest running this one of two different ways. Elemental Capacitor if you're on either void or stasis, and then Golden Tricorn if you run any other subclass."  tags:god-pvp,pvp,controller,mnk

// A Distant Pull
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): Recommended MW: Handling. Rapid-Fire Frame(140) Stasis Sniper Rifle Special Ammo.  "A Distant Pull is not going to be great in the Crucible. You can roll some really high handling, but without Snapshot Sights, some players won’t even look at it, and being a rapid-fire other players won’t even equip it. These snipers are not as dominant as they used to be before their double body nerf and haven’t seen the sun since. Moving Target and Opening Shot will bump up your aim assist to 100 and you can craft this sniper for either 90 range or 90 handling. While it has some amazing stats, the frame and lack of snapshot will just put it under." |tags:pvp,controller

// Age-Old Bond
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): Recommended MW: Stability. High-Impact Frame(360) Void Auto Rifle Primary Ammo.  "In PvP there are simply better options right now. Unlocking the patterns and getting them ready in the event of a buff would be wise, but quick killing weapons with good forgiveness coupled with Target Lock are the name of the game. Age-Old Bond kills quickly but does not have much in terms of forgiveness. Target Lock drops your 6 crit requirement down to 5 crit 1 body, not changing the time to kill, but making it ever so slightly more forgiving. With a bigger buff like Kill Clip you drop an entire shot needed to 4 crit 1 body. Not the most meta option." |tags:pvp,controller
dimwishlist:item=424291879&perks=1015611457,1890422124,3142289711,839105230

// Apex Predator
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): Recommended MW: Velocity. Adaptive Frame(20) Solar Rocket Launcher Heavy Ammo.  "Apex Predator is the best rocket launcher in the game. With enhanced Reconstruction you can almost always have a rocket ready to fire at any given time. With Explosive Light you get incredible amounts of damage and orbs are easy to make now. Bait and Switch is another great damage perk and does more damage, but I find Explosive Light easier to work with, especially with the new mod system revolving around orbs of power. Simple answer is, use Explosive Light if you’re lazy, if you’re trying to min-max use Bait and Switch." |tags:pvp,controller

// Cold Comfort

// Epochal Integration
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): Recommended MW: Handling. Adaptive Frame(140) Solar Hand Cannon Primary Ammo.  "Epochal is honestly a great PvP gun. The issue is mostly the other guns it has to compete against. Palindrome and Exalted Truth are stat monsters and basically bully Epochal Integration into obscurity. It will be great if you never earned either of those hand cannons and is a good stepping stone for newer players. I wouldn’t use this if you know you have better guns in your vault." |tags:pvp,controller

//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): Recommended MW: Range or Shield Duration. Rapid-Fire Glaive(80) Solar Glaive Special Ammo.  "In PvP I can see more blinting possibilities with Greasy Luck. // Mercurial Overreach
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): Recommended MW: Handling. Adaptive Frame(90) Arc Sniper Rifle Special Ammo.  "In PvP you’ll find a lot of Guardians opting for the tried and true Snapshot Sights and Opening Shot Combo. With the right investments (aka all handling) you can have the most coveted sniper perks alongside 92 handling. Almost making this the fastest sniper in the game, but certainly one with both Snapshot Sights and Opening Shot at the same time. The Supremacy can also reach 92, but that’s on a rapid-fire frame. Defiance of Yasmin (Harrowed) can reach 82 but that is with adept mods. Silicon Neuroma (Adept) is the highest aggressive frame at 59. On an adaptive sniper, this is the highest handling you can get without using things like Dragon’s Shadow, Ophidians, or even Slickdraw." |tags:pvp,controller

// Nation of Beasts
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): Recommended MW: Stability. Adaptive Frame(140) Arc Hand Cannon Primary Ammo.  "There aren’t a lot of hand cannons that see top tier usage in PvP. Opening Shot, Keep Away, and Perpetual Motion in one column, and Explosive Payload and Kill Clip in the other make for a stacked package. Add in enhanced perks and you have a recipe for a super solid hand cannon. Eye of the Storm or Fragile Focus would round out the mix for best perks on a hand cannon, but overall it’s a solid choice. Hard to say if this is stronger than Palindrome and Exalted Truth, but it certainly holds its own. You’ll have to fight some of the weird gun model though." |tags:pvp,controller

// Old Sterling
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): Recommended MW: Stability. Adaptive Frame(600) Strand Auto Rifle Primary Ammo.  "Adaptive autos have not been meta in quite a while. It was back when Hard Light was too strong that adaptive autos felt like they had a place. What a weird time to be playing Destiny. It was like a light show all the time in PvP. Nowadays you’re going to have to do a lot to make adaptive autos feel strong. Surplus will bring up all your stats. Harmony when paired with a special weapon can also make multikills feel like a breeze if you couple the two. A fast handling, good feeling auto with a damage bump. Takes a lot to make this auto work, but I’m sure someone wants to." |tags:pvp,controller

//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): Recommended MW: Stability. Rapid-Fire Frame(260) Kinetic Scout Rifle Primary Ammo. // Techeun Force
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): Recommended MW: Range. Adaptive Frame(660) Arc Fusion Rifle Special Ammo.  "In PvP you could also recommend Techeun Force as the best fusion in the game and I will. Arrowhead Brake with a CB mod brings the recoil to 100, so you can invest the rest of the fusion into range via Projection Fuse and Rangefinder. If you value kill chaining you could go for Reconstruction and Controlled Burst for never reloading and getting that 20% damage increase. Another niche use case would be Kill Clip and Kickstart for a nice 4 bolt kill, you’d have to be sprinting immediately after reloading but the enhanced version extending Kill Clip’s timer will help you out." |tags:pvp,controller

// Transfiguration
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): Recommended MW: Stability. High-Impact Frame(150) Kinetic Scout Rifle Primary Ammo.  "In PvP there aren’t a ton of reasons to use a high-impact scout. Jade Rabbit and Polaris Lance were dominant but not as strong any more. The rise and fall of scouts are typically accompanied by a slower game, pulses and SMGs are dominant right now because you’re either playing passively or aggressively, there aren’t too many middle avenues. Scouts cater to the former but on a higher end. If you do want to try this scout out in PvP you will need more than just Explosive Payload and some prayers." |tags:pvp,controller

// The Title
//notes:SirStallion_ (PvP / Controller): "I don't like Rangefinder. [...] BUT there's no denying that people like it, and they should. So it's very easily swapped in, in place of Vorpal. Now then, why Vorpal? Well, it just feels like the best of the bunch for passive PvP usage. More damage on supers good. As for Flared Magwell over Ricochet or Hi-Cal, I like my stability bumped up when possible and there's nothing worse than being caught mid reload on something as heavy as a 750. Loader mods will help, but Flared is worth the investment for me." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:pvp,controller

// Taraxippos
//notes:SirStallion_ (PvP / Controller): "I just need to shoutout that Kill Clip is right there in slot 4 also, and that would be great too. However, my thought process with this roll is that I want to make any given engagement as easy for me as possible (High stab, Zen Moment) while also being as much of a nuisance for the enemy as I can (Low flinch intake, Explosive Payload) So while I do think the KC 3 taps will go hard, I'm here to be a menace, not a slayer." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:pvp,controller

// Astral Horizon
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): Recommended MW: Range. Aggressive(55) Kinetic Shotgun Special Ammo.  "Most Crucible players should rejoice over this shotgun returning. The issue lies in its competition. Imperial Decree is easier to farm, has comparable stats, and while not getting adept mods, is able to stay stat for stat compared to Astral Horizon (Adept). Taking a look at both shotguns with Barrel Shroud, Accurized, Threat Detector, Opening Shot, and a Range masterwork / frame. Even with an adept Range mod on Atral Horizon both shotguns have the same range stat of 79, handling is actually best on Imperial Decree by 2 (43 to 41). Meaning it might just be better to farm out an Imperial Decree unless you really like glow on your weapons." |tags:pvp,controller

// Astral Horizon (Adept)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): Recommended MW: Range. Aggressive(55) Kinetic Shotgun Special Ammo.  "Most Crucible players should rejoice over this shotgun returning. The issue lies in its competition. Imperial Decree is easier to farm, has comparable stats, and while not getting adept mods, is able to stay stat for stat compared to Astral Horizon (Adept). Taking a look at both shotguns with Barrel Shroud, Accurized, Threat Detector, Opening Shot, and a Range masterwork / frame. Even with an adept Range mod on Atral Horizon both shotguns have the same range stat of 79, handling is actually best on Imperial Decree by 2 (43 to 41). Meaning it might just be better to farm out an Imperial Decree unless you really like glow on your weapons." |tags:pvp,controller

//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): Recommended MW: Stability. Rapid-Fire(540) Kinetic Pulse Rifle Primary Ammo.  "It’s always fun when a weapon drops where it should perform. // Jorum's Claw
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): Recommended MW: Stability. Adaptive(390) Solar Pulse Rifle Primary Ammo.  "In PvP you’re really looking for consistency. The adaptive frame pulse rifles can two-burst with any damage bonus. This makes Kill Clip highly sought-after but having a more neutral pulse and surge mods can make this weapon also two-burst. With one surge mod you can two-burst all the way up to 7 resilience. Requiring all headshots. With two surge mods you can two-burst up to 8 resilience. 9 resilience with all three surge mods. Tier 10 will never get two bursted without Kill Clip but it’s nice to know if your RNG doesn’t favor you." |tags:pvp,controller

// Marsilion-C
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): Recommended MW: Blast Radius. Rapid-Fire(150) Solar Grenade Launcher Heavy Ammo.  "In the crucible you might want a different grenade launcher. Perpetual Motion is the best in slot for column three and Impulse Amplifier is the best for Column four. On other grenade launchers like Memory Interdict you can roll Impulse Amplifier with a better fourth column perk for either damage or consistency. Marsilion-C is great if you don’t have a grenade launcher for PvP but I would not rely on it being the best." |tags:pvp,controller

// Mykel's Reverence
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): Recommended MW: Range. Rapid-Fire(450) Strand Sidearm Primary Ammo.  "In PvP being a rapid-fire frame means this sidearm has extremely limited range. It will shut down shotgun apes and fusion rushers with ease but it does mean you are hard capped at around 15m of range. Being able to bring up the stability will make putting down those rushers easier but it will still require 5 crits and a body shot to kill 10 resilience Guardians. High risk decent reward." |tags:pvp,controller

// Phyllotactic Spiral
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): Recommended MW: Stability. High-Impact(340) Arc Pulse Rifle Primary Ammo.  "In PvP you can run a counterbalance mod or Arrowhead Brake if you prefer a different mod. Keep Away is the in slot and paired with Headseeker you will have a great neutral pulse rifle. If you get the jump on someone you’ll have the bonus range and a near perfect first burst. They turn on you, start flinching you, headseeker then comes into play to keep you on that two-burst. Kill Clip is another viable option for a more forgiving two-burst after your first kill, especially when paired with Tunnel Vision. Elemental Capacitor will only accentuate the neutral game of this pulse no matter what subclass you use. Whatever you use this pulse will be a great addition to any vault." |tags:pvp,controller

// Round Robin
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): Recommended MW: Stability. Aggressive(120) Strand Hand Cannon Primary Ammo.  "In PvE Subsistence with Golden Tricorn will be your bread and butter for never ending shooting and a huge damage buff. This works with a build that ability loops by itself like Heart of Inmost Light. If you can keep up Golden Tricorn 2x constantly you will have an incredibly high damage hand cannon. Envious Assassin is an interesting perk as you’ll need to swap off your primary to get kills to overflow your magazine to swap back to your primary. If you are running double primary weapons in higher end content or just like to switch up weapons for clearing rooms you will love this perk. However, I just find it odd to need to swap off your primary to overflow your primary." |tags:pvp,controller

// Senuna SI6
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): Recommended MW: Range. Omolon Adaptive(491) Stasis Sidearm Primary Ammo.  "Senuna SI6 is arguably the best three-burst sidearm. Slickdraw gives you 100 handling. A counterbalance mod gives you 99 recoil direction. You can then invest entirely into range as Omolon Fluid Dynamics will give you your stability. The only issue is the fourth column perk. Headstone is great in 3v3. Elemental Capacitor can bump up your stability on void, or forgo a counterbalance mod on Stasis. If you jump a lot then Strand could be a great option for you. Headseeker is another good option. Ideally I would run Headstone just for locking down that position and having some cover as well. Certainly a gun I will farm for and then throw in my vault to use on random loadout shenanigans." |tags:pvp,controller

// The Immortal
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): Recommended MW: Range. Aggressive(750) Strand Submachine Gun Primary Ammo.  "Immortal is running the crucible and it is not hard to see why. // Aurvandil FR6
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "In PvP there aren't a lot of pros for high-impact fusions. They are certainly strong and they are my favorites to use. But the charge time increase really hurt their overall utility. The change to 5 bolts was nice, but not having high-impact reserves in this weapons perk pool is a bit of a let down. Elemental capacitor can make it feel super consistent on void, arc or stasis. Firmly planted will make the shot you do take incredibly consistent, void or not." Recommended MW - Range.|tags:pvp,controller

//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "Lodbrok-C in PvP will be an interesting weapon. High-impact frames have some chunky damage and allow for some great team shooting potential. // Long Arm
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Long Arm also opens up some neat builds in PvP. Being able to use legendary and exotic kinetics with a DMT-lite will open up so many different play styles and options. Rapid hit or hip-fire grip are going to be player dependent. Hip firing Long Arm or having better follow up shots when aiming down sights will depend on you. Opening shot will ensure that your first shot is going to connect. Explosive payload will introduce added flinch and even some small AoE." Recommended MW - Stability.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller

// Wilderflight
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "I don’t know how to feel about Wilderflight in PvP. I have yet to fully test out the full damage of each grenade, but disruption break will still probably be then play. // Fire and Forget
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "In terms of using fire and forget in PvP. It’s kind of a mixed bag. It can definitely feel good and has some forgiveness you don’t really find on heavy weapons. I like aggressive bursts for PvP but I don’t find myself reaching for them often. Maybe a crafted version will change that. Go for as low of a charge time with as high handling and as much range you can fit into this wonderfully sexy weapon. Rangefinder will help keep aim assist at range, and high-impact reserves will help if you miss part of the burst." Recommended MW - Charge Time.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller

// IKELOS_SG_v1.0.3
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Rapid-fire frame shotguns have not had a strong presence in PvP either. Their recent change to a fixed spread will help but their poor ammo economy on top of the gamemodes 1 shot per brick leads to a bad taste. They can be strong when barrel stuffing your opponent, but any shotgun will do then. I would just stay away from rapid-fire shotguns until there is a really strong incentive to use them." Recommended MW - Handling or Range.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=1168625549&perks=1482024992,3142289711,4071163871,4082225868

// IKELOS_SR_v1.0.3
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "In PvP you will have to decide if this sniper is good enough. Snipers are incredibly personal and what works for one person will not always work for others. The zoom, the scope, the feel will all determine your success. Elemental capacitor on arc subclasses will maximize your handling, but elemental capacitor on stasis or void is another great option for movement speed and stability, respectively." Recommended MW - Handling.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller

// Tripwire Canary
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "In PvP lightweight bows are not the strongest choice. You can definitely make them work in either a swap build or by team-shooting with them. Opening shot is going to ensure a crit when you’re in the same postal code as your opponent, or you could go for flinch city and roll with explosive head. It’s a niche play style but you can build into it." Recommended MW - Draw Time.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller

//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "In terms of using fire and forget in PvP. It’s kind of a mixed bag. It can definitely feel good and has some forgiveness you don’t really find on heavy weapons. I like aggressive bursts for PvP but I don’t find myself reaching for them often. Maybe a crafted version will change that. Go for as low of a charge time with as high handling and as much range you can fit into this wonderfully sexy weapon. Rangefinder will help keep aim assist at range, and high-impact reserves will help if you miss part of the burst." Recommended MW - Charge Time.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller

// IKELOS_SR_v1.0.3
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "In PvP you will have to decide if this sniper is good enough. Snipers are incredibly personal and what works for one person will not always work for others. The zoom, the scope, the feel will all determine your success. Elemental capacitor on arc subclasses will maximize your handling, but elemental capacitor on stasis or void is another great option for movement speed and stability, respectively." // Veles-X
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Veles-X will still have some incredible usefulness in PvP as well. Tunnel vision and kill clip are perfect with one another. At base you have an incredible pulse that can two burst. With kill clip it makes that two burst more forgiving but you also have tunnel vision for more aim assist. With the recent change to kill clip and tunnel vision, both can be refreshed so it keeps both perks active whenever you get a kill." Recommended MW - Stability.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=2276328320&perks=1015611457,2946784966,3230963543,3661387068

// Albruna-D
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "For PvP it is a decent zoom high-impact frame. You can make a choice between opening shot or snapshot if you crank up the handling high enough. Elemental capacitor will certainly help with that. Perpetual motion and moving target are also both incredible perks on snipers, one boosting low stats, the other adding forgiveness through aim assist." // Wendigo GL3
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Wendigo is interesting in PvP. I wouldn’t use it, but I also wouldn’t be upset with someone if they did. It has utility and it can work similar to other grenade launchers. Proximity grenades adds forgiveness and flexibility. Impulse amplifier makes it more of a pocket rocket launcher, and rangefinder will just make whatever arc the grenade has minimal. Another good shout is explosive light. If you hold onto your explosive light shots, or build it up without having power ammo, you will have even more flexibility with the added damage, and be able to counter supers with ease." Recommended MW - Blast Radius.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller

// Blowout
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Blowout is an interesting core playlist weapon. Being a rocket launcher there isn’t much you want in PvP. You want your rocket to go where you’re shooting so either impulse amplifier for the zoom or tracking module to ensure it gets to where it should be. Then you want to make sure your one rocket counts so you choose chain reaction or cluster bomb. There really isn’t a lot to think about when it comes to PvP rockets." Recommended MW - Blast Radius.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller

// Gunnora’s Axe
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "With the current state of slug shotguns, you do want to go for as much range as possible while maintaining as high of handling as possible. Threat detector and opening shot are the S tier combo to get. Iron reach and moving target are decent substitutes as long as you have the handling to back it up."
